channel.title: Powerautomate on SomethingWentWrong.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Powerautomate on SomethingWentWrong.dev

item.title: Parse data using AI-Prompt instead of REGEX in PowerAutomate
item.description:
Problem

I need to monitor emails from a ticketing system for certain types of emails, that’s where PowerAutomate can do all the boring stuff.

General flow describtion

Flow has steps listed below:

  1. Get an email from a specific mailbox folder (emails get there via inbox rule)
  2. Convert HTML (email body) into TEXT (for raw output)
  3. Run a prompt to get a specific info from email
  4. Save a prompt output into JSON to easily proceed
  5. In my scenario I use switch as I work on two types of emails
  6. If email is about DL - save a new row into DL sheet
  7. If email is about a shared mailbox - save a new now into SharedMailboxes sheet

Summary

Emails can be easily accessed using PowerAutomate, Excel tables can be easily written using PowerAutomate. The issue starts when a specific part of an email should be written into Excel - REGEX would be helpful, if supported.
